tuv.seg: You must appeal within 21 days of the notification of the decision on your claim
Oifig Achomharc Leasa Shóisialaigh
The Social Welfare Appeals Office (SWAO) operates independently of the Department of Social Protection
Más dóigh leat gur diúltaíodh sochar leasa shóisialaigh go héagórach duit, tá sé de rogha agat achomharc a dhéanamh in aghaidh an chinnidh seo chuig an Oifig Achomharc Leasa Shóisialaigh
It aims to provide an independent, accessible and fair appeals service with regard to entitlement to social welfare payments and to deliver that service in a prompt and courteous manner
Mura bhfuil tú sásta le cinneadh a rinne Oifigeach Cinnidh Leasa Shóisialaigh, is féidir leat achomharc a dhéanamh freisin. Oifig neamhspleách reachtúil í an Oifig Achomharc Leasa Shóisialaigh
The Office is headed by a Chief Appeals Officer and has its own Appeals Officers who make decisions on appeals
Ciallaíonn sé go bhfeidhmíonn an Oifig Achomharc go neamhspleách ar an Roinn Coimirce Sóisialaí
You can get a list of social welfare schemes and benefits covered by the Social Welfare Appeals Office (pdf)
Áfach ní bhíonn an Oifig ag déileáil leis na gnéithe lánroghnach den scéim
The Social Welfare Appeals Office also deals with appeals for some payments under the Supplementary Welfare Allowance Scheme
Tá liosta scéimeanna agus sochair leasa shóisialaigh faoi chumdach na hOifige Achomharc Leasa Shóisialaigh ar fáil
If you have been refused a social welfare payment or you disagree with a decision of a Deciding Officer or Designated Person you must appeal within 21 days of the decision
Is féidir leat achomharc a dhéanamh laistigh de 21 lá chuig an Oifig Achomharc Leasa Shóisialaigh

In exceptional cases, appeals received outside of this period may be accepted. You must set out in your appeal why you think the decision was not correct and include any evidence and documents you want to be considered by the Social Welfare Appeals Office

Más dóigh leat gur diúltaíodh sochar leasa shóisialaigh go héagórach duit in Éirinn, nó mura bhfuil tú sásta le cinneadh a rinne Oifigeach Cinnidh Leasa Shóisialaigh, ba chóir duit achomharc a dhéanamh
You can request an oral hearing at this stage
laistigh de 21 lá ó rinneadh an cinneadh
If you are still not happy with the decision following the Department’s clarification you can appeal the decision to the SWAO.│
Glacfar le hachomhairc i ndiaidh na tréimhse seo i gcásanna eisceachtúla
Once an appeal has been lodged the Social Welfare Appeals Office (SWAO) notifies the Department of Social Protection of the appeal
Seolfar admháil chugat nuair a fhaigheann an Oifig Achomharc an achomharc a rinne tú
When the Department of Social Protection receives notice of an appeal it reviews the original decision to decide whether it should be revised in your favour
ar dtús, caithfidh an Oifig Achomhairc cur do chás ar aghaidh go dtí an Roinn Coimirce Sóisialaí lena dtuairimí a fháil
In some cases, this means that new evidence is reviewed by a medical assessor or a social welfare inspector
D'fhéadfadh an Roinn athbhreithniú ar a cinneadh ag an bpointe seo de thoradh na fianaise nua a chuireadh os a comhair
If the decision is changed by the Department at this stage you will be informed
Má bheartaíonn siad gan aon athrú a dhéanamh, áfach, déanfaidh Oifigeach Achomhairc do chás a mheas
If the decision is not changed by the Department, your case will be examined by an Appeals Officer
D'fhéadfadh an Oifigeach Achomhairc cinneadh a dhéanamh ar d'achomharc bunaithe ar fhianaise i scríbhinn
Your appeal may be heard at an oral hearing—either because you have requested one or because the Appeals Officer decided that this is appropriate for your appeal
I gcásanna eile d'fheadfadh an tOifigeach Achomhairc cuireadh a thabhairt duit teacht chun agallaimh agus do chás a phlé
You will be invited to attend this hearing
Agallamh neamhfhoirmiúil é seo
It is informal and you can bring a representative to the hearing with you for support or assistance
D'fhéadfá cara, comhghleacaí, ionadaí poiblí nó oifigeach ceardchumainn a bheith agat mar ionadaí
A representative may include a friend, colleague, public representative or trade union official
Tá sé de chead agat ionadaí dlí a thabhairt leat más mian leat é - ach ní gá é seo
Hearings are held in private
Bíonn na héisteachtaí seo príobháideach
Generally, the decision of an Appeals Officer is final
De ghnáth níl aon dul thar cinneadh Oifigeach na nAchomharc
However, an Appeals Officer may revise their decision if new evidence, new facts or any relevant change of circumstances come to light after a decision is made
Féadfaidh Oifigeach na nAchomharc athbhreithniú ar a c(h)inneadh má thagann fianaise nua, fíricí nua nó athrú ábharach ar chúinsí chun solais tar éis dó/di cinneadh a dhéanamh
If you don't agree with the Appeals Officer's decision
Mura n-aontaíonn le cinneadh a rinne Oifigeach Breithiúnachta
The Chief Appeals Officer may revise a decision of an Appeals Officer if it appears that a mistake was made in relation to the law or the facts
D'fhéadfadh Príomh-Oifigeach na nAchomharc athbhreithniú ar chinneadh Oifigigh na nAchomharc má dhealraíonn sé gur rinneadh botún i leith an dlí nó i leith na bhfíricí
In either case you should send a written request for a revised decision and enclose the new evidence
Ar aon chaoi ba chóir duit iarratas i scríbhinn a sheoladh chun athbhreithniú ar chinneadh a fháil
It is important to state the grounds on which you are seeking a revised decision
Tá sé tábhachtach na cúiseanna a chur in iúl atá leis an athbhreithniú ar chinneadh atá tú ag lorg
If you are seeking a review by the Chief Appeals Officer, you must give specific reasons why you believe a mistake has been made regarding the law or the facts
Mura n-aontaíonn tú le cinneadh deiridh na hOifige Achomhairc, is féidir leat iarratas chuig na hOifige an Ombudsman chun do chás a scrúdú
If you disagree with the final decision of the Social Welfare Appeals Office you can request the Office of the Ombudsman to examine your case
Tá an ceart ag an Ombudsman an cothroime in aon cinneadh déanta ag an Oifig Achomhairc a breathnú
You may appeal to the High Court on a point of law or seek a judicial review in the High Court if you think that the appeal was not fairly conducted
Féadfaidh tú achomharc a dhéanamh chun nahArd-Chúirte faoi phointe dlí nó athbhreithniú dlíthiúil a iarradh san Ard-Chúirt má mheasann tú nár caitheadh go cothrom le d'achomharc
You should however get legal advice in this situation
(Sa chás sin ba chóir duit comhairle dlí a fháil)
Non-statutory social welfare schemes
Scéimeanna neamhreachtúla leasa shóisialaigh
The Social Welfare Appeals Office does not deal with schemes that are not on a statutory basis - for example, the Household Benefits Scheme or the Free Travel Scheme
Ní dhéileálann an Oifig Achomharc Leasa Shóisialaigh le scéimeanna nach bhfuil bunús reachtúil acu - mar shampla, na scéimeanna saora agus na scéimeanna le filleadh ar obair

There is no formal appeals system for these schemes. However, if you are not satisfied, you should ask for the decision to be reviewed by the section in the Department of Social Protection that dealt with your application

Níl aon chóras foirmeálta ann le hachomharc a dhéanamh i gcás na scéimeanna seo, ach mura bhfuil tú sásta ba chóir duit a iarradh go ndéanfaidh rannóg an Roinn Coimirce Sóisialaí, a dhéileáil le d'iarratas, athbhreithniú an cinneadh
The Social Welfare Tribunal is a special statutory appeals system for people who are refused Jobseeker's Benefit or Jobseeker's Allowance because of an industrial dispute at their place of employment

Is an Bínse Leasa Shóisialaigh é córas reachtúil achomhairc do dhuine a dhiúltaítear Sochar Cuardaitheora Poist nó Liúntas Cuardaitheora Poist le haghaidh aighneas tionsclaíoch ar siúl ina (h)ionad oibre
It provides a second level of appeal after an appeal to the Social Welfare Appeals Office
Is an Binse é dara leibhéal achomhairc tar éis achomharc chuig an Oifig Achomharc Leasa Shóisialaigh
However, you can also appeal directly to the Tribunal without first going through the Social Welfare Appeals Office
Áfach, is féidir achomarc a dhéanamh díreach chuig an Binse, gan an chéad achomharc chuig Oifig Achomharc Leasa Shóisialaigh
There is no fee for making an appeal about a social welfare decision to the Social Welfare Appeals Office
Níl aon táille i gceist chun achomharc a dhéanamh faoi chinneadh leasa shóisialaigh chuig Oifig Achomharc Leasa Shóisialaigh
If you have to travel to attend a hearing, the Social Welfare Appeals Office will compensate you for any reasonable travel expenses
Má bhíonn ort taisteal le bheith i láthair ag éisteacht, déanfaidh an Oifig Achomharc cúiteamh a thabhairt duit ar aon chostas réasúnta taistil
You can also be compensated for any loss of earnings if you have to take time off work to attend
Is féidir aon chaillteanas íocaíochta a chúiteamh leat freisin, má bhíonn ort fanacht amach ó obair le bheith i láthair
The Social Welfare Appeals Office may make an award to a representative such as a solicitor if they accompany you to the appeal
Féadfaidh an Oifig Achomharc dámhachtain a dhéanamh le hionadaí, dlíodóir mar shampla, a rachadh leat chun na héisteachta
You make your application on the special Social Welfare Appeals form (pdf), also available from your Intreo centre or social welfare local office or the Social Welfare Appeals Office

Déan d'iarratas ar an fhoirm achomhairc leasa shóisialaigh speisialta (pdf) atá le fáil ó d'oifig leasa shóisialaigh áitiúil, nó féadfaidh tú na cúiseanna atá agat achomharc a dheanamh a scríobh i litir agus í a sheoladh chuig an Oifig Achomharc
Alternatively, you may set out the grounds of your appeal in a letter to the Appeals Office or by email to swappeals@welfare.ie
Caithfidh tú an fhaisnéis seo a leanas a sholáthair i d'achomharc:
• Your Personal Public Service Number
• Do Uimhir Phearsanta Seirbhíse Poiblí
• The payment you are claiming • The decision you are appealing against
• An cineál íocaíochta a bhfuil á héileamh agat
• The reasons you disagree with the decision
• An cinneadh a bhfuil achomharc á dhéanamh agat ina aghaidh
In some cases, the Appeals Officer decides to hold an oral hearing
• Na fáthanna nach n-aontaíonn tú leis an gcinneadh a rinneadh
Further information is available in Social Welfare Appeals Office - An Introduction (pdf)
Is féidir breis eolais a fháil faoi Oifig na nAchomharc Leasa Shóisialaigh in Oifig na nAchomharc - Treoir Gearr Tosaigh
Information and advice is also available from your Intreo centre, local social welfare office or from the Social Welfare Appeals Office
Is féidir faisnéis agus comhairle a fháil ón d’oifig leasa shóisialaigh áitiúil freisin, nó go díreach ón Oifig Achomharc féin
